dea
Class Rank

java.lang.Object
  dea.Rank

public class Rank
extends java.lang.Object

This class only deals with implementing the bubblesort algorithm to find the DMU ranks.

Most of the code is based on the code developed by algolist which can be found below.

Author:
Hubert Virtos
See Also:
Algolist Bubble sort Algorithm Implemetation

Method Detail

getRanks

public static int[] getRanks(double[] arrayToSort,
                             boolean HighestIsOne,
                             RankingType TypeOfRanking,
                             int Precision)
Returns the ranks.

Parameters:
arrayToSort - The Array To sort (DMU Objectives)
HighestIsOne - A boolean. If true, specifies that the highest values of the ArrayToSort should be '1' (i.e. first).
Precision - An int value to specify at which decimal place the scores need to be rounded up prior to been ranked. This is important as most of the scores of the 'efficient' DMUs are not 1 but some value very close to 1 (e.g. 1.00000000000002). All precisions between 0 and 16 are taken into account, any other int value would leave the scores unchanged.
Returns:
An int[] with the rank positions.

roundToDecimals

public static double roundToDecimals(double d,
                                     int c)
